title: J.K. Rowling Donates $18.9 Million to MS Research
text:
J.K. Rowling attends the UK Premiere of "Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes Of Grindelwald" at Cineworld Leicester Square on November 13, 2018 in London, England. The highest-paid author has donated a further $18.9 million to MS clinic. WireImage/Getty Images

Text size

J.K. Rowling has donated £15.3 million (US$18.9 million) to the University of Edinburgh in further support of its research on multiple sclerosis (MS), the Harry Potter author announced on her website Thursday.

The donation, inclusive of Gift Aid, will help the university create new facilities and research at the University’s Anne Rowling Regenerative Neurology Clinic, which Rowling founded in 2010 with an initial donation of £10 million. The clinic is named in memory of her mother, who died of multiple sclerosis in 1990 at the age of 45.
description: The Harry Potter author further funds the Anne Rowling Clinic at the University of Edinburgh
